frameDefinitions: This frame involves a static (primarily spatial) relationship between a Location and a Theme, in which the Theme is located in many or all subregions of the Location, and is thus construable as covering it.
The lexical units in this frame have to do with an Entity being in a State of order or disorder.
A Figure is located relative to a Ground location.
This frame has to do with people (the Residents) residing in Locations, sometimes with a Co-resident.
An Agent who is engaged in an Undertaking accords a Degree of importance to a Consideration that influences the success of an Undertaking.
frameExamples: Soon the system was in total <t><fex name='St'>chaos</fex></t>.
The hand <t>around</t> the sword-hilt was no less impressive than the sword .
Our company <t>emphasizes</t> marketing tried and true products and services.INI
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Theme</fen> in this frame is the object which is described as standing in some spatial relation to a particular <fen>Location</fen>.  <fen>Theme</fen> typically occurs as the External Argument or, with passives, as a PP Complement headed by 'with' or 'by'.
<fen>Location</fen> is the entity or area with respect to which the <fen>Theme</fen>'s spatial arrangement is described.  This frame element generally occurs as an NP Object.
The time at which the <fen>Theme</fen> occupies the <fen>Location</fen>.
The object or phenomenon which exists in the <fen>State</fen> of disorder.  It is common for the <fen>Entity</fen> to be null instantiated in this frame.
The <fen>State</fen> in which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists.  Usually the <fen>State</fen> will be the target-denoting noun.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists in the <fen>State</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> exists in the <fen>State</fen>.
The <fen>Figure</fen> is the entity located with respect to the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The <fen>Ground</fen> is the area that the <fen>Figure</fen> surrounds.
The area or zone immediately external to the <fen>Ground</fen>.  This role excludes <fen>Figure</fen> and is only used in particular constructions such as the following:
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Figure</fen> is located around the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The <fen>Ground</fen> serves as a basis for describing the location of the <fen>Figure</fen>.
The <fen>Figure</fen> is perceived as located relative to a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location. The figure can be an entity or an event.
The <fen>Figures</fen> are items which mutually serve to identify the location of the other items.
The region within which a <fen>Figure</fen> might be found.  This role is exclusive of <fen>Figure</fen>, and is a reconstrual that is not possible with verb lexical units.
The period of time during which the locative relation between <fen>Figure</fen> and <fen>Ground</fen> obtains.
The individual(s) that reside at the <fen>Location</fen>.
The place in which somebody resides.
A person or group of people that the resident is staying with or among.
This role refers to the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Resident</fen> resides.
An event or state of affairs, an attribute, or an entity whose properties have the potential to influence the success of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the individual who devotes time, concentration, or other resources to a <fen>Consideration</fen> that is important for the success of a larger <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The <fen>Competing_consideration</fen> is another factor that is relevant to the <fen>Undertaking</fen> to which the <fen>Agent</fen> devotes less attention or effort.
The <fen>Artifact</fen> is a physical object designed with some <fen>Consideration</fen> in mind, such that it functions to facilitate the <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> is performed with importance placed on the <fen>Consideration</fen>.
The time period during which the <fen>Agent</fen> attaches a specified degree of importance to the <fen>Consideration</fen> to further the success of the <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> attaches the specified level of importance  to the <fen>Consideration</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Ribbons</fex> festooned the car.
Thick varnish coated <fex>the beautiful wood</fex>.
<fex>By 1950</fex>, factories dotted the adjacent countryside.
Subsequent bomb alerts caused <fex>travel</fex>chaos in the London Underground.
More <fex>chaos</fex> awaits the Soviet Union unless it ditches perestroika for a Thatcherite purge of its economy.
Monica Lewinksy in 1998 gave him a rich new target, as did the electoral chaos <fex>of 2000</fex>.
Lying in bed listening to the chaos <fex>downstairs</fex>, he knew his conquest had only been temporary.
He had <fex>both hands</fex> wrapped around her arm .
We looked <fex><t>around</t></fex> the trees .
The cat is on <fex>the mat</fex>.
<fex>The cat</fex> is on the mat.
<fex><t>Next to</t> the kitchen</fex> is the best place to locate your garage .
He was in Athens <fex>on Friday</fex>.
<fex>Hannah</fex> lives in San Francisco.
Sue lives <fex>in Berkeley</fex>.
Boris still lives <fex>with his parents</fex>.
The ICBL has prioritised <fex>working to achieve universalisation of the Mine Ban Treaty in South Asia by 2004</fex>.
Dell said Friday <fex>the company</fex> will put more emphasis on selling software
Monophysite Christians  emphasized Christ's divinity <fex>over his humanity</fex>.
Water is a scarce commodity on French Island so <fex>the guest house</fex> places strong emphasis on water conservation.
Result Oriented <fex>Management</fex>
<fex>In the 1960s</fex> Foucault placed great weight on the notion of archeology.
<fex>In Arizona</fex> we emphasize western bats with a special focus on species identification.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the late 19th to the early 20th century
